packagegui.name: quagga_ospfd
packagegui.title: Services: Quagga OSPFd

field.description: Password to access the Zebra and OSPF management daemons. Required.
If set to yes, Logs will be written via syslog.
If set to yes, adjacency changes will be written via syslog.

Specify the Router ID. RID is the highest logical (loopback) IP address configured on a router.
For more information on router identifiers see wikipedia.

OSPFd area for this instance of OSPF.
For more information on Areas see wikipedia.
Disables the updating of the host routing table(turns into stub router).
Enables the redistribution of connected networks (Default no)
Enables the redistribution of a default route to this device (Default no)
Enables the redistribution of static routes (only works if you are using quagga static routes)
Enables the redistribution of kernel routing table (this is required if using pfsense static routes)

Set the SPF holdtime in milliseconds. The minimum time between two consecutive shortest path first calculations.
The default value is 5 seconds; the valid range is 1-5 seconds.

Set SPF delay in milliseconds. The delay between receiving an update to the link state database and starting the shortest path first calculation.
The default value is 1; valid range is 1-10 seconds.
If set to yes, decisions regarding AS-external routes are evaluated according to RFC 1583. The default is no.

field.fielddescr: These rules take precedence over any redistribute options specified above.

field.description:
IP address used to determine the CARP status. When the VIP is in BACKUP status, quagga will not be started.
NOTE: Requires changes to /etc/rc.carpmaster to start quagga and /etc/rc.carpbackup to stop quagga or it will not be fully effective.
